intro: Ludwigia erecta, commonly known as the upright Ludwigia, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Onagraceae family and is characterized by its striking red or orange flowers. The plant typically grows in wetlands, marshes, and along riverbanks, thriving in moist to aquatic conditions. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a reddish hue, adding visual interest to its habitat. Ludwigia erecta is also cultivated as an ornamental plant in water gardens and ponds.
